column1: #Delete this row (row 1) and row 3 and 4 before use. Save as a csv. Only the first three columns are required. Any columns not used should be deleted. Do not include empty cells. This file has been populated for use with the Hydrologic Monitoring Reporting Format template for the data file and follows the requirements for the File Level Metadata Reporting Format and CSV Reporting Format.
Provide entries for each Column Name from the data matrix in the data file.
column2: Provide variable units of measurement. Insert "N/A" when units aren't applicable. Data should be represented with units of measurement approved by the International System of Units (SI). Non-SI units are accepted for use and should be defined and referenced.
column3: A complete unambiguous description. Information may include: formulas used to calculate entry; definitions of coding systems (e.g. missing values, quality flags, etc.); detection limits; timestamp calculation; measurement of uncertainty, etc.
column4: Longer human-readable column name. Sometimes this may be identical to Definition or even Name.
column5: Column header, row header, or data flag

column3: Cell indicates number of header rows
Example parameter. User should only include parameters for their dataset. See Recommended Vocabulary file for recommended column headers and definitions
Deviation from one or more method IDs in the header rows for the matching column of data.
Example parameter. User should only include parameters for their dataset. See Recommended Vocabulary file for recommended column headers and definitions
